summary: Ronald Adrine was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is identified in several certification and payroll reports from 1978 and 1979. Specifically, a payroll authorization form from December 8, 1995, notes his appointment as Staff Counsel with an annual salary of $27,000.00. The documents indicate his involvement with the HSCA payroll during the period of its operation.
significance: Ronald Adrine's significance lies in his role as Staff Counsel for the HSCA, contributing to the investigation of the JFK assassination. His presence on payroll records indicates his involvement in the committee's operations during its active period.
